benchmark_details.name: FinEval (Financial Domain Knowledge Evaluation Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: FinEval is designed to evaluate the financial domain knowledge and practical abilities of large language models (LLMs) with a focus on various aspects of finance including academic knowledge, industry knowledge, security knowledge, and agent capabilities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of FinEval is to provide a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating the capabilities of large language models in the Chinese financial domain, particularly focusing on financial security and agent tasks.

data.source: Publicly accessible mock exams and adaptations from various financial websites, created and reviewed by financial experts.
data.annotation: Questions were adapted from existing exams and manually reviewed by financial professionals.

methodology.calculation: Metrics such as Accuracy are calculated based on the proportion of correct answers out of the total questions in each task category.
methodology.interpretation: A higher score indicates better performance in evaluating financial knowledge and abilities of the models being tested.
methodology.baseline_results: Claude 3.5-Sonnet achieved the highest weighted average score of 72.9 under zero-shot settings.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis of performance across different demographic groups in financial knowledge.
harm: Inaccurate financial advice leading to poor investment decisions.
